title: Add XML sitemap for search engine indexing

requirements.text: Generate a static XML sitemap file at `frontend/public/sitemap.xml` that lists all public pages of the SafarX site including: Home (/), Destinations (/destinations), each individual destination detail page (/destinations/:id for all destinations in destinations.ts), Packages (/packages), Plan Trip (/plan-trip), Contact (/contact), and Community (/community). Each URL entry should include a <loc> with the canonical domain (safarx.in), a <lastmod> date, a <changefreq> value appropriate to the page type, and a <priority> value reflecting page importance (e.g., Home = 1.0, main sections = 0.8, detail pages = 0.6).
acceptanceCriteria: sitemap.xml is present in frontend/public/ and is served at /sitemap.xml
All public routes are listed including all destination detail pages derived from the static destinations data
The <loc> values use the canonical domain https://safarx.in
The sitemap is valid XML and passes standard sitemap schema validation

requirements.text: Add a sitemap reference to `frontend/index.html` by inserting a `<link rel="sitemap" type="application/xml" title="Sitemap" href="/sitemap.xml" />` tag in the document <head>, and also add a robots.txt file at `frontend/public/robots.txt` that allows all crawlers and points to the sitemap URL (https://safarx.in/sitemap.xml).

quotes: A sitemap is essentially a map of all your website's pages that you submit to search engines

acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html contains a <link rel="sitemap"> tag pointing to /sitemap.xml
frontend/public/robots.txt exists and contains a Sitemap directive pointing to https://safarx.in/sitemap.xml
robots.txt allows all user-agents to crawl the site

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui/
Sitemap must be a static file, not dynamically generated at runtime via the backend
nonGoals: Dynamic sitemap generation via Motoko backend
Automatic sitemap submission to Google Search Console
Adding new pages or routes beyond what currently exists
